intro: Cleome goudotii, commonly known as the spider flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive, often branched inflorescences that resemble spider legs, hence its common name. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers in shades of white, yellow, and red, which bloom throughout the growing season. Cleome goudotii is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, low-maintenance ornamental plants. Its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators make it both ecologically and aesthetically valuable.
